reviews.text: I have stayed many times at this hotel dropping of my daughter as it is right next to CSU. You will see by the lobby it looks like a former Embassy Suite with the atrium design. Rooms are always good and staff is very helpful. The locatoin right next to campus is a big plus. This hotel is easiy the nicest hotel right off campus.
reviews.title: College Drop Off

reviews.text: Starbucks downstairs and a lobby restaurant which I've used for breakfast. Never tried the menu but they have a "cold" and "hot buffet" about 14 & 18 dollars if I recall. Pretty typical hotel food.
reviews.title: Serviceable

reviews.text: Overall for biz or to visit you the college this is my to to hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay and helpful staff
Beware
reviews.text: Was in town on business and stayed here because that was where the room block was..... Standard Hilton, only worth staying here if you are on an expense account. I am not anti-hilton chain. I just prefer Hampton Inns, but it was booked. The location is definitely only tolerable if you have a car...not very walkable to anywhere of interest aside from the University. But it didn't matter really as there really isn't much worth seeing in Fort Collins...typical wonderbread western town amped up by a smattering of serviceable microbrews and restaurants. Scenes from South Park kept popping into my head while walking around old town. Suffice to say I would never go to FC again by choice, even if I had a car. Not my bag so to speak.

I have been to the Fort Collins, CO Hilton twice now a year apart, for an annual panel meeting. The Hilton provides good service for the stay and for meetings - good conference room setup and service.. Only the quality of coffee at the break was of a not so good quality although the snacks were good! The shuttle to the Old Town and the courtesy of their service overall are excellent!
reviews.title: Good choice for lots of reasons

reviews.text: This is an excellent location - great place in town, ample parking, and safe location. All plusses. And, if you are facing the correct side of the property, you get to wake up to the mountains, which is nice.
reviews.title: Not your typical Hilton - lacks some "perks"

reviews.text: But, the hotel is obviously dated -- which is fine in and of itself, but I kind of felt like Hilton was pricing everything as if this were the latest and greatest. And, it's not. It's just a captive audience -- I mean, where else are you gonna stay in Fort Collins?
reviews.title: Stranded by flood
Stay ONLY at the Fort Collins Hilton
reviews.text: Breakfast expensive (though, they did have some nice, unusual offerings, including Greek yogurt and nice fruit).
My bill was wrong and it did take a while to get that straightened out.
reviews.title: Could use improvement

reviews.text: This hotel was the best. I could not get home because of the flooding around town. When I told them I couldn't get home because of the flood, this hotel gave me a great discount. I would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Title?

reviews.text: This was a business trip. Won't stay again as internet was not free. There is no free breakfast. Just the little things that should be provided at this cost level, that just are not there. Already have a different place booked for a return trip in September.
reviews.title: Very Expensive for What You Get

reviews.text: Great views of the mountains, and the rooms were very large with a separate sitting area. The lobby was high-ceiling and vast. However, there were reasons I didn't rate it a "5": A) the restaurant had a limited menu and the food was average at best; B) the room had no refrigerator. Everything else, including friendliness and professionalism of staff was great. Then morning breakfast buffet, while overpriced, was excellent in quality.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great views, attractive lobby.

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, very comfortable, very clean, great staff, close to historic old town, Colorado State University, and the Veterinary Hospital. Will stay here for sure the next time I am in Fort Collins.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay While in Fort Collins

reviews.text: Stayed in a king room on the 6th floor with mountain views and loved every moment. Starbucks coffee stand in the lobby makes it sweet. Food is OK and there are many great restaurants in Old Town to choose from. Free shuttle service brings you anywhere within 3 miles. Very friendly and helpful staff. That its location is outside of the hubbub of Old Town appealed to me making my stay more calm and restful. Thank you.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: clean, quiet and comfy. The hotel was fine, except the elevator was slow, causing me to take the stairs a few times (6 flights up). Great if you have CSU business. The gym has many dumb-bell free weights and your usual exercise machines. I would stay again if I was in town again.
reviews.title: quick ft. collins stay

reviews.text: The hotel itself was fine, clean,staff in general were very good, especially in the lobby. Room was spotless. My only gripe is the food was second rate, and it seemed to presented as an afterthough. bad menu.
reviews.title: good hotel,bad food

reviews.text: Clean, well run, great bed and bedding, all the necessary things to make my stay a good one. There is a free shuttle that goes into Old Town that runs all day and evening. Didn't actually eat there, but there is a nice restaurant, lobby bar, and a Starbucks, all in the lobby. Very happy with the experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Ft. Collins

reviews.text: It's just an average hotel, not one of their best. Rooms appear dated, although it's a non-smoking facility you can certainly smell the faint odor of cigarettes. I must admit that it is better than most. Restrooms are small, somewhat claustrophobic. The AC has a motion sensor so be prepared to sweat during your sleep. Don't be afraid to ask the front desk to override the sensor. It's possible! Lobby feels almost inviting. I'm a diamond member so I was not charged all of those pesky fees for internet and such.
reviews.title: Average Hilton, nothing to brag

reviews.text: The room was a little warm, but the bed was a dream! The restaurant seemed to be only open for breakfast and lunch, though there was a menu for room service that included lunch dinner. The front desk recommended a great place across the street and even offered a $5 coupon! I was there for a quick business trip. Service was excellent and it was very convenient. My only disappointment was trouble with the internet that cost me some work time.
reviews.title: Not bad for a quick stay

reviews.text: I was surprised that, at a Hilton, for ~ $150/night, the ventilation louvers were dirty, the ironing board was stained, and the cover to the iron's water reservoir was broken. Otherwise, the room was alright.
reviews.title: ventilation louvers dirty, ironing board stained
